FuncDef:
The avp calling-number interface-format exclude sub-slot command sets the format for encapsulating BAS interface information into AVP 22 attributes carried in L2TP packets to slot/port.
The undo avp calling-number interface-format exclude sub-slot command restores the default setting.
By default, the format for encapsulating BAS interface information into AVP 22 attributes carried in L2TP packets is slot/sub-slot/port.
CLIs: undo avp calling-number interface-format exclude sub-slot
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The BAS interface format in the calling-number AVP attribute sent by Redback devices is slot/port. Therefore, a Huawei device functioning as an LAC needs to use the same format when exchanging calling-number AVP attribute information with a Redback device. To set the format to slot/port, run the avp calling-number interface-format exclude sub-slot command in the L2TP group view.
Precautions
The avp calling-number interface-format exclude sub-slot command takes effect only when the BAS interface on the LAC is an Eth-Trunk, GE.
The avp calling-number interface-format exclude sub-slot command takes effect only when the source tunnel interface configured for the LNS backup group on the LTS is an Eth-Trunk or GE interface.
